entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the main character who is talking and interacting with other characters. He is described as looking between people and saying something about Rita Skeeter's article.

entities.name: rita skeeter
entities.description: Rita Skeeter is mentioned as a journalist who wrote an article in Witch Weekly that Harry is referring to. She is not physically present but her writing has an impact on the story.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone whose relationship with Harry is being discussed. Mrs. Weasley's behavior towards Hermione changes after Harry's statement.

entities.name: bill
entities.description: Bill is mentioned as one of the people who went for a walk with Harry and Mrs. Weasley.

entities.name: mrs weasley
entities.description: Mrs. Weasley is mentioned as someone who is initially skeptical about Rita Skeeter's article but becomes warmer towards Hermione after Harry's statement.

entities.name: ludo bagman
entities.description: Ludo Bagman is mentioned as a person who has joined the staff table and looks cheerful.

entities.name: cornelius fudge
entities.description: Cornelius Fudge is mentioned as someone who looks stern and is not talking. He is sitting next to Madame Maxime.

entities.name: madame maxime
entities.description: Madame Maxime is mentioned as someone who is concentrating on her plate and has red eyes, which Hagrid keeps glancing at.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is mentioned as someone who keeps glancing along the table at Madame Maxime.

entities.name: witch weekly
entities.description: Witch Weekly is mentioned as a newspaper that published Rita Skeeter's article.

relationships.description: Harry mentions Rita Skeeter's article in Witch Weekly.
Harry denies that Hermione is his girlfriend.
Mrs. Weasley did not believe Rita Skeeter's article.
Harry's statement makes Mrs. Weasley warmer towards Hermione.
Ludo Bagman is seated next to Cornelius Fudge.
Hagrid keeps glancing along the table at Madame Maxime.
